value.title: Power BI Apps for Consumers
value.excerpt: Adam looks at how you can use Power BI Apps as a consumer of dashboards and reports. Power BI Apps are the main way that dashboards and reports are distributed widely in your organization.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: Power BI for the NON-TECHnical person
value.excerpt: Is Power BI intimidating? Coming from Microsoft Excel? You consider yourself non-technical? Don't want to have to write or know anything about DAX? Patrick looks at how you can create a report quickly with just your Excel data and not have to write any code!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Power BI Incremental Refresh - Understanding Detect Data Changes

Download Patrick's free cheat-sheet: https://guyinacu.be/detectdatachangescheatsheet  Incremental refresh documentation - https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-premium-incremental-refresh

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Sort By A Measure Not Shown In Visual
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Patrick shows you how you can sort by a measure not show in a visual within Power BI Desktop. This was something we didn't even know about until recently and it a great little Power BI nugget. If you wanted to sort by something not shown in a visual, this video is for you!

value.title: What is this delta lake thing?
value.excerpt: You may be using a lake for your data and it may just be regular parquet files. Connect with Stijn https://twitter.com/SQLStijn  What is Delta Lake https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/synapse-analytics/spark/apache-spark-what-is-delta-lake
